item.title: Treasury Yields Keep Pushing Higher
item.description: Treasury yields advanced in early trading, as prices fell. Stock futures were up slightly.

item.title: Metal Prices Inch Higher Amid Macro Uncertainty
item.description: Metal prices were rising, reversing some of the previous session’s losses, as worries over sticky U.S. inflation keep pressure on commodities.

item.title: Oil Steadies After Fed Hints at Possibility of More Rate Rises
item.description: Oil markets steadied, having fallen sharply late Wednesday, with weak Chinese economic data and the possibility of more interest-rate hikes from the Fed hitting sentiment.

item.title: USD/JPY's Bullish Bias Resumes, Charts Show
item.description: USD/JPY’s bullish bias resumes, based on technical charts, Oanda said, with the currency pair having broken above the 145.50-146.10 resistance area, where Japan’s FX intervention took place on Sept. 22.

item.title: ASX Has Solid IPO Pipeline, But Waiting for Right Market Conditions, CEO Says
item.description: Australia’s primary securities exchange ASX said it has a pipeline of potential IPOs that it could activate under the right economic conditions.

item.title: Philippines Central Bank Holds Rate Steady as Inflation Moderates
item.description: The Philippine central bank maintained its benchmark interest rate, as domestic inflation has moderated lately.

item.title: Plant-Based Plastics Gain Favor as Companies Pursue Sustainability Goals
item.description: Bioplastic production is growing at a record clip amid strong demand from fashion and food-packaging companies, in particular.

item.title: Standard Bank Earnings Rise by More Than a Third
item.description: Standard Bank posted a 35% increase in headline earnings to ZAR21.2 billion in the first half, attributing the rise to growth in its three banking businesses.

item.title: BAE Systems Targets Ball Unit in U.S. Expansion
item.description: BAE Systems has agreed to buy Ball’s aerospace business for $5.6 billion in cash and targeted closing the deal in the first half of 2024.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise as Investors Expect High Policy Rates for Long
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields were trading higher as investors bank on high-for-longer monetary policy rates in developed markets.

item.title: BAE Systems' Buy of Ball's Aerospace Unit a "Vote of Confidence" for Defense Industry
item.description: BAEs’ acquisition of Ball’s aerospace division is unsurprising, and provides a positive read across to the wider industry, Shore Capital said, which has a fair value price target of 1,205p on the U.K. group.

item.title: Aegon Reports Improved Profits, Capital Generation
item.description: Aegon said its operating result rose to €818 million for the first half of 2023, with an above-forecast 13% rise in capital generation on business growth and improved claims.

item.title: Gold Fields Profits Fall on Lower Output
item.description: Gold Fields reported a drop in earnings per share for the half year to 51 cents, in line with guidance it provided earlier this month, as lower volumes sold and higher operating costs were only partially offset by stronger prices.

item.title: Lenovo Group's First-Quarter Profit Declined 66%
item.description: Lenovo Group’s net profit fell 66% in its first quarter, weighed by its business in intelligent devices and infrastructure solutions.

item.title: Why There Hasn't Been a Recession---Yet
item.description: A year ago a majority of economists expected a recession. So where’d it go? WSJ explains the four main economic factors that have kept a recession at bay, at least so far.

item.title: Ortega Regime Seizes Catholic University in Nicaragua
item.description: The government took over the Jesuit university after a court labeled it a “center of terrorism.”

item.title: Stock-Market Rally Makes More 401(k) Savers Millionaires
item.description: Despite this year’s turnaround, the number of people with retirement account balances of at least $1 million hasn’t returned to its peak.

item.title: Target said shopper backlash over the retailer's Pride Month collection, as well as consumer caution, pushed sales sharply lower in its most recent quarter.
item.description: Target said shopper backlash over the retailer’s Pride Month collection, as well as consumer caution, pushed sales sharply lower in its most recent quarter.

item.title: Vietnam's VinFast Auto became the latest electric-car startup to soar to an outsize valuation after completing a nontraditional stock offering that on paper put it ahead of GM and Ford.
item.description: Vietnam’s VinFast Auto became the latest electric-car startup to soar to an outsize valuation after completing a nontraditional stock offering that on paper put it ahead of GM and Ford.

item.title: Setbacks securing the release of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and other Americans held in Russia through a trade for high-profile Russians jailed in other countries have forced U.S. officials to refocus on a deal involving Russian prisoners in U.S. custody.
item.description: Setbacks securing the release of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and other Americans held in Russia through a trade for high-profile Russians jailed in other countries have forced U.S. officials to refocus on a deal involving Russian prisoners in U.S. custody.
